text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion states that the response incorrectly states that guardianship automatically grants power over all financial and personal decisions without judicial limitations. The candidate answer explicitly contradicts this potential error by stating, under Section 4.1, that the guardian 'can act only on the matters expressly authorised by the judge' and that if a new need arises, the guardian must 'request a modification of the decree from the judge.' This demonstrates a correct understanding that powers are limited by the judicial decree, thus satisfying the negative condition of the rubric criterion.", "criterion_id": "8cd172aa-79b6-4745-9610-d45cdac4333e"}
